programme.title: Las Vegas Bowl: Houston vs. San Diego State
programme.desc: Houston (9-3) vs. San Diego State (10-3) in Las Vegas. Houston's third-ranked rushing defense faces RB Donnel Pumphrey, who became college football's No. 2 all-time rusher in SDSU's Mountain West title-game win. Pumphrey needs 108 yards for the record. The Cougars seek their third straight bowl win, while the Aztecs are 3-3 since 2010. (live) (cc)(n).

programme.title: The 700 Club
programme.desc: A religious-themed newsmagazine, one of TV's longest-running programs. On the air since 1966, it launched nationally in '72, before becoming the flagship of the Christian Broadcast Network in 1977. It mixes news---from a religious perspective---with inspirational interviews with celebrities, along with Bible readings and entertainment. Conservative icon (and 1988 presidential candidate) Pat Robertson founded the hugely popular program from a 1963 fund-raising pledge effort on UHF TV in Virginia. (cc)(

programme.title: The 700 Club
programme.desc: A religious-themed newsmagazine, one of TV's longest-running programs. On the air since 1966, it launched nationally in '72, before becoming the flagship of the Christian Broadcast Network in 1977. It mixes news---from a religious perspective---with inspirational interviews with celebrities, along with Bible readings and entertainment. Conservative icon (and 1988 presidential candidate) Pat Robertson founded the hugely popular program from a 1963 fund-raising pledge effort on UHF TV in Virginia. (cc)(

The result: one of Fox's longest-running series (it premiered in March 1989). It also spawned a number of police-reality imitators. Initially filmed only in Broward County, Fla., the series went on to show officers in locations across the country. (repeat)(n).

programme.title: English Premier League Soccer
programme.sub-title: Stoke City FC vs. Leicester City FC
programme.desc: Leicester has won only one of the last seven matches at Stoke City in all competitions, the 1-0 Premier League victory on Sept. 13, 2014. The only goal of that fixture was netted by Leonardo Ulloa. The Foxes drew 2-2 at Stoke last season(n).(n)

programme.title: English Premier League Soccer
programme.sub-title: West Ham United FC vs. Hull City AFC
programme.desc: West Ham has won six consecutive league home matches against Hull City, including all four in the PL, since the 2-1 defeat in the second tier on Jan. 20, 1990 when Neil Buckley and Andy Payton netted for the Tigers(n).(n)

programme.title: PGA Tour Golf: Wells Fargo Championship
programme.desc: Final-round play in the $7.3 million Wells Fargo Championship in Charlotte. Rory McIlroy dominated this event last year, setting a new tournament scoring record by five shots; shooting a course-record 61 on Saturday; and winning by seven strokes. (cc)(

programme.title: PGA Tour Golf: Players Championship
programme.desc: Final-round play in the Players Championship at the TPC at Sawgrass in Ponte Vedra Beach, Fla. Trailing by five shots with six holes to play, Rickie Fowler played the last six holes at six-under par, forced a playoff and won on the fourth extra hole. (cc)(

programme.title: PGA Tour Golf: AT&T Byron Nelson
programme.desc: Final-round play at the AT&T Byron Nelson in Irving, Texas. (cc)(

programme.title: PGA Tour Golf: Dean & DeLuca Invitational
programme.desc: Final-round play in the Dean & DeLuca Invitational in Fort Worth. Last year, after Brandt Snedeker missed a 12-foot birdie putt on the final hole, Chris Kirk knocked in a seven-footer for par to win this event by a single stroke. (cc)(

programme.title: PGA Tour Golf: Memorial Tournament
programme.desc: Final-round play in the Memorial Tournament at the Jack Nicklaus-designed Muirfield Village Golf Club in Dublin, Ohio. Last year, Sweden's David Lingmerth defeated Justin Rose on the third hole of a playoff to claim his first PGA Tour win. (cc)(

programme.title: PGA Tour Golf: St. Jude Classic
programme.desc: Final-round play in the $6.2 million St. Jude Classic in Memphis. Argentina's Fabian Gomez got his first Tour victory in this event last year, shooting a final-round 66 to defeat England's Greg Owen by four shots. (cc)(

programme.title: PGA Tour Golf: Quicken Loans National
programme.desc: Final-round play in the Quicken Loans National at Congressional Country Club in Bethesda, Md. Troy Merritt got his first PGA Tour victory in this event last year in Gainesville, Va., defeating Rickie Fowler by three strokes. (cc)(

programme.title: PGA Tour Golf: Barracuda Championship
programme.desc: Barracuda Championship final-round play at the Montreux Golf and Country Club in Reno. (cc)(

programme.title: PGA Tour Golf: WGC-Bridgestone Invitational
programme.desc: Final-round play in the $9.5 million WGC-Bridgestone Invitational at the Firestone Country Club in Akron. Ireland's Shane Lowry got his first PGA Tour win here last year, shooting a final-round 66 to defeat Bubba Watson by two strokes. (cc)(n).

programme.title: PGA Tour Golf: Barbasol Championship
programme.desc: Final-round play in the Barbasol Championship at the Robert Trent Jones Trail at Grand National in Opelika, Ala. (cc)(n).

programme.title: PGA Tour Golf: RBC Canadian Open
programme.desc: Final-round play in the RBC Canadian Open at the Glen Abbey Golf Club in Oakville, Ont. (cc)(n).

programme.title: PGA Tour Golf: Travelers Championship
programme.desc: Final-round play in the $6.6 million Travelers Championship in Cromwell, Conn. Last year, Bubba Watson got his second victory in this event, holding off a charging Paul Casey and winning on the second hole of a playoff. (cc)(n).

programme.title: PGA Tour Golf: John Deere Classic
programme.desc: Final-round play in the John Deere Classic at TPC Deere Run in Silvis, Ill. (cc)(n).

programme.title: PGA Tour Golf: Wyndham Championship
programme.desc: Final-round play in the Wyndham Championship at Sedgefield CC in Greensboro, N.C. (cc)(n).

programme.title: PGA Tour Golf Playoff: The Barclays
programme.desc: Final-round play in The Barclays, the year's first FedExCup Playoff event at Bethpage State Park in Farmingdale, N.Y. Last year, Jason Day shot a 63 and a 62 in the final two rounds to win this $8.5 million tourney by six shots over Henrik Stenson. (cc)(n).

programme.title: PGA Tour Golf Playoff: Deutsche Bank Championship
programme.desc: Final-round play in the Deutsche Bank Championship at the TPC of Boston in Norton, Mass. This playoff event was won by Rickie Fowler last year, who came from three strokes back with eight holes to play to defeat Henrik Stenson by a single shot. (cc)(n).

programme.title: PGA Tour Golf Playoff: BMW Championship
programme.desc: Final-round play in the BMW Championship in Carmel, Ind. Last year in Lake Forest, Ill., Jason Day led wire-to-wire to win this tourney by six shots over Daniel Berger. It was his fourth victory in his last six events. (cc)(n).

programme.title: PGA Tour Golf Playoff: Tour Championship
programme.desc: Final-round play in the Tour Championship at East Lake Golf Club in Atlanta. Patrick Reed, Rory McIlroy and Dustin Johnson won the first three playoff events this year. Last year, Jordan Spieth won this tourney and also claimed the FedExCup title. (cc)(n).(n)

programme.title: PGA Tour Golf: Safeway Open
programme.desc: Final-round play in the $6 million Safeway Open at Silverado CC in Napa, Cal. This event opens the 2016-17 season. Emiliano Grillo won this event last year when it was known as the Frys.com Open. (cc)(n).(n)

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: ESPN's flagship program provides a thorough presentation of sports news, highlights and analysis. The Emmy-winning show revolutionized the sports-news genre by deftly mixing information with irreverence in a hip, daily scrapbook of homers, touchdowns and slam dunks, the perfect clips-and-controversies fix for sports junkies. Staple features besides game scores and highlights include expert breakdowns, `Top Ten Plays', Web polls and trivia. (live) (cc)(

programme.title: New Mexico Bowl: Texas (San Antonio) at New Mexico
programme.desc: Texas (San Antonio) (6-6) at New Mexico (8-4). UTSA makes its first-ever bowl appearance, paced by all-time school rushing leader Jarveon Williams (2,268 yards). The Lobos feature a pair of top RBs in Teriyon Gipson (1,209 yards) and Tyrone Owens (1,084) as they eye their second bowl win since 1961. They fell 45-37 in this game last year. (live) (cc)(n).

programme.title: Camellia Bowl: Appalachian State vs. Toledo
programme.desc: Appalachian State (9-3) vs. Toledo (9-3) in Montgomery, Ala. Sun Belt co-champ ASU won this game last year in its bowl debut behind MVP Marcus Cox, who shares RB duties with Jalin Moore (1367 yards). The Rockets lean on All-MAC QB Logan Woodside (43 TDs) and RB Kareem Hunt, who is 24 yards from joining Cox as his school's all-time rushing leader. (live) (cc)(n).

programme.title: New Orleans Bowl: Southern Mississippi vs. Louisiana (Lafayette)
programme.desc: Southern Mississippi (6-6) vs. Louisiana-Lafayette (6-6) at the Superdome. The Ragin' Cajuns are in this game for the fifth time in six years, with LB Otha Peters leading the defense against QB Nick Mullens and a potent Southern Miss attack (472 ypg). Mullens returned from a concussion in his last game and became the Golden Eagles' all-time leader in TD passes with 86. (live) (cc)(n).(n)
